resource_dependency.questionDataSchema: Table 'questions' with fields: id (UUID), topic (string), question_text (text), options (array of strings), correct_option_index (integer), explanation (text)

function: Allow users to browse and select individual practice questions by topic or randomly.
static_description: A vertically scrollable panel with categorized question cards. Above the cards is a dropdown labeled 'Select Topic' using the 'topicDropdownOptions'. Background is floral white; all components use dark goldenrod for borders and text.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking a question card navigates to the question detail view. Clicking the dropdown toggles the topic selection menu.
Changing the topic dropdown value filters the displayed question cards to match the selected topic. Selecting 'Random' displays shuffled questions from all topics.

resource_dependency.examDataSchema: Table 'exams' with fields: id (UUID), user_id (UUID), started_at (timestamp), completed_at (timestamp), score (float), total_questions (integer), correct_answers (integer)

function: Enable users to take full-length simulated driver's license exams under timed conditions.
static_description: A clean full-screen layout featuring a countdown timer ('timerComponent') at the top right corner, followed by sequential question views with multiple-choice options. Submit button at bottom. Background is floral white; all UI elements use dark goldenrod styling.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking 'Start Exam' initializes the timer and loads the first question. Clicking an option selects it. Clicking 'Next Question' proceeds forward; clicking 'Previous Question' goes back unless itâ€™s the first.
When time runs out, auto-submits current answers and redirects to results page.
Clicking 'Submit Exam' sends responses via 'examSubmitAPI', calculates score, and redirects to the results page.

resource_dependency.errorExplanationPopupContent: Displays why the chosen answer was wrong and what the correct reasoning should have been.

function: Provide detailed feedback on incorrect answers from previous exams.
static_description: A dashboard listing each incorrectly answered question in expandable rows. Each row shows the question, user-selected answer marked with 'incorrectAnswerIcon', and the correct answer marked with 'correctAnswerIcon'. Background is floral white; all text and icons styled in dark goldenrod.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking a row expands it to show the detailed explanation defined in 'errorExplanationPopupContent'.

resource_dependency.passFailIndicator: Green checkmark if passed, red X if failed

function: Show calculated scores and performance metrics immediately after completing a simulated exam.
static_description: A centered modal or dedicated result screen showing the formatted score ('scoreDisplayFormat'), pass/fail indicator ('passFailIndicator'), number of correct vs total questions, and average time per question. Background is floral white; all metrics are highlighted in dark goldenrod.

interaction_and_states.description: Upon loading, fetches results via 'examResultsAPI' and populates the score information dynamically.
Clicking 'Review Answers' navigates to the error analysis page for this exam.

function: Apply consistent visual theme across entire website with floral white background and dark goldenrod component coloring.
static_description: All pages feature a base background color set to '#FFFAF0' (floral white) and all interactive and static components styled with '#B8860B' (dark goldenrod) including buttons, headers, dividers, and form controls.

resource_dependency.frontendFramework: React.js with Axios for HTTP requests

function: Ensure all frontend data related to questions and exams comes exclusively from backend APIs without any hardcoded or mock data.
static_description: The frontend app built using React.js displays dynamic content fetched through Axios calls to endpoints like '/api/questions' and '/api/exams'. Data rendering depends entirely on successful API responses.

interaction_and_states.description: Each component mounts and triggers useEffect hooks to call respective backend endpoints such as 'fetchQuestionsEndpoint'.
If an API request fails, display an inline error message instead of crashing the UI.

resource_dependency.databaseORM: Sequelize ORM configured to connect using above environment variables

function: Establish secure connection between backend services and PostgreSQL database using predefined environment variables.
static_description: Server-side code uses Sequelize ORM initialized with credentials sourced directly from environment variables listed in 'postgresConnectionEnvVars'. No hard-coded credentials appear in source files.

resource_dependency.usersTableSchema: CREATE TABLE users (id UUID PRIMARY KEY, username VARCHAR(255), created_at TIMESTAMP);
resource_dependency.questionsTableSchema: CREATE TABLE questions (id UUID PRIMARY KEY, topic TEXT, question_text TEXT, options TEXT[], correct_option_index INTEGER, explanation TEXT);
resource_dependency.responsesTableSchema: CREATE TABLE responses (id UUID PRIMARY KEY, user_id UUID REFERENCES users(id), exam_id UUID, question_id UUID REFERENCES questions(id), selected_option INTEGER, is_correct BOOLEAN);
resource_dependency.examsTableSchema: CREATE TABLE exams (id UUID PRIMARY KEY, user_id UUID REFERENCES users(id), started_at TIMESTAMP, completed_at TIMESTAMP, score FLOAT, total_questions INT, correct_answers INT);

function: Define relational database schema to support storing user data, questions, responses, and exam records.
static_description: PostgreSQL tables created based on schemas provided in 'usersTableSchema', 'questionsTableSchema', 'responsesTableSchema', and 'examsTableSchema'. All tables linked relationally via UUID references where applicable.

resource_dependency.topicSelectorUI: Dropdown with options from available topics plus 'Random'
resource_dependency.randomizerLogic: Shuffle algorithm applied before presenting questions

function: Allow users to filter questions by topic or access randomized sets of practice questions.
static_description: At the top of the question browsing section, there is a styled dropdown ('topicSelectorUI') containing topic options and 'Random'. Below it appears a grid or list of filtered/randomized questions. Floral white background; dark goldenrod accents.

interaction_and_states.description: Selecting a topic filters the visible questions accordingly. Choosing 'Random' applies 'randomizerLogic' to shuffle and present questions.

resource_dependency.timerLogicModule: JavaScript-based countdown logic initialized at 45 minutes
resource_dependency.examTimeoutHandler: Function triggered when timer reaches zero

function: Implement timing mechanism during simulated exams to replicate real testing scenarios.
static_description: Top-right corner displays active countdown timer initialized to 45 minutes using 'timerLogicModule'. Timer updates every second visually while decrementing internally. Styled in dark goldenrod against floral white.

interaction_and_states.description: Initiates the timer countdown which begins updating in real-time.
Triggers 'examTimeoutHandler' which submits the exam automatically and redirects to the results screen.

function: Maintain historical record of user exam attempts for future review.
static_description: Dedicated tab or section titled 'My Exam History' lists past exams in chronological order. Each entry includes date taken, score, and duration formatted according to 'historyEntryFormat'. Background is floral white; entries styled with dark goldenrod.

interaction_and_states.description: On mount, fetches history via 'examHistoryAPI' and renders each entry as a clickable row.
Clicking an exam entry navigates to that specific exam's results and/or error analysis.

resource_dependency.answerExplanationField: Text field within question object explaining rationale behind correct/incorrect choices
resource_dependency.explanationDisplayStyle: Inline beneath selected answer once revealed

function: Reveal explanations for both correct and incorrect answers after submission or upon viewing errors.
static_description: After submitting an answer or reviewing a past question, an additional block appears below the options displaying explanation text derived from 'answerExplanationField'. Text styled consistently in dark goldenrod over floral white.

interaction_and_states.description: Immediately reveals whether the choice was correct and shows the explanation inline using 'explanationDisplayStyle'.
Navigating to the error analysis also displays relevant explanations alongside each reviewed item.

resource_dependency.touchFriendlyControls: Larger tap targets and spacing optimized for fingers

function: Ensure seamless experience on desktops, tablets, and smartphones.
static_description: Layout adjusts fluidly using CSS media queries ('responsiveMediaQueries'). Buttons and inputs increase in size ('touchFriendlyControls') on smaller screens. Consistent floral white background and dark goldenrod accents maintained across devices.

interaction_and_states.description: Adjusts layout and reflows content appropriately depending on viewport width, maintaining readability and usability.

resource_dependency.sessionStorageMechanism: Browser sessionStorage used to preserve temporary state
resource_dependency.sessionPersistenceAPI: Optional API endpoint to save session progress server-side

function: Track user activity and maintain exam state even if browser refreshes occur mid-session.
static_description: During active exam sessions, answers and current position saved temporarily using 'sessionStorageMechanism'. Optional sync via 'sessionPersistenceAPI' allows restoring unsaved progress later.

interaction_and_states.description: Restores last known exam state from sessionStorage if present, preventing loss of work.
Prompts confirmation dialog to prevent accidental exit mid-exam.

resource_dependency.installScript: "install:all": "concurrently \"cd frontend && npm install\" \"cd backend && npm install\"
resource_dependency.devScript: "dev": "concurrently \"cd frontend && npm start\" \"cd backend && npm run dev\""

function: Configure package.json scripts to enable unified installation and parallel development startup of frontend and backend.
static_description: Root-level package.json contains two custom scripts: 'install:all' executes concurrent installations in frontend and backend directories, and 'dev' concurrently starts both development servers as defined in 'installScript' and 'devScript'.

interaction_and_states.description: Executing 'npm run install:all' installs dependencies in both projects simultaneously. Running 'npm run dev' launches both apps together in watch mode.
